-f|--force.#desc: ignore nonexistent files and arguments, never prompt

-I.#desc: prompt once before removing more than three files, or when removing recursively; less intrusive than -i, while still giving protection against most mistakes

--interactive.#desc: prompt according to WHEN: never, once (-I), or always (-i); without WHEN, prompt always

--one-file-system.#desc: when removing a hierarchy recursively, skip any directory that is on a file system different from that of the corresponding command line argument

--preserve-root.#desc: do not remove '/' (default); with 'all', reject any command line argument on a separate device from its parent

-r|-R|--recursive.#desc: remove directories and their contents recursively
